Class Clock

java.lang.Object
  Clock

public class Clock
extends java.lang.Object

Creates an object of the clockDisplay class and outputs the clock to the terminal window.

Version:
1.0 2015-02-24
Author:
Kevin Qin

          Construtor for clock class that constructs a stopwatch.
Clock(int minuteLimit, int hourLimit, int minuteValue, int hourValue)
          Construtor for clock class that constructs a clock that shows the actual time.

Constructor Detail

Clock

public Clock(int minuteLimit,
             int hourLimit)
Construtor for clock class that constructs a stopwatch. Once created, this stopwatch will start counting

Parameters:
minuteLimit - the limit of this clock's number of minutes. Must be a positive integer
hourLimit - the limit of this clock's number of hours. Must be a positive integer

Clock

public Clock(int minuteLimit,
             int hourLimit,
             int minuteValue,
             int hourValue)
Construtor for clock class that constructs a clock that shows the actual time. Once created, clock will start counting

Parameters:
minuteLimit - the limit of this clock's number of minutes. Must be a positive integer
hourLimit - the limit of this clock's number of hours. Must be a positive integer
minuteValue - this clock's current minute value. Must be a positive number and be less than the limit
minuteValue - this clock's current hour value. Must be a positive number and be less than the limit
Method Detail

main

public static void main(int[] argument)
creates an object of the clock class

Parameters:
argument -
    Element
  1. the limit this clock's minutes. Must be a positive integer
  2. the limit this clock's hours. Must be a positive integer
  3. the value of this clock's minutes. Must be a positive number and be less than the limit
  4. the value of this clock's hours. Must be a positive number and be less than the limit
